page.title: 17HOLYMOORSIDE HISTORICAL SOC.
page.content:
The Holymoorside and District Historical Society is one example of a successful{village society.} Founded in 1973, the society{aims}to study the history of the local area and maintain the history of the present.
The society has an{open membership and their meetings often enjoy an audience of 40 to 50. Meetings are held in the{Village Hall}once a month from September to June. The meetings usually involve a talk by a speaker followed by a time for questions. Very often the meeting adjourns to the{Bull {Inn}in the village.
In June the society has an annual visit. In 1985 there was a visit to the{Kilham Island Industrial Museum in Sheffield.
